alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 7:32PM MDT until August 28 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River near Artesia 6E affecting Eddy County. For the Pecos River...including Artesia 6E, Carlsbad 9NW (Damsite 3), Carlsbad 2E, below Dark Canyon, Malaga 3ESE, Malaga 10S, Girvin 3NNW, Sheffield 3ESE, Rio Penasco Dayton 2WNW, Rocky Arroyo Lakewood 7S, Dark Canyon Carlsbad, Black River Malaga 5W, Delaware River Red Bluff 11NW, Independence Creek Sheffield 18SSE...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecos River near Artesia 6E. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, the river reaches bankfull. Overbank flooding occurs about 1/2 mile upstream from the gage and spreads onto the flood plain. As a result, river width increases to approximately 1 mile in some reaches. Minor flooding of low-lying areas occurs, but no significant damage is expected. At 12.5 feet, the river reaches minor flood stage. Structures at Wilbank Trucking, Inc., located approximately 1/4 mile east of the gage, begin to flood. At 13.5 feet, the river reaches the floor of the instrument shelter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday afternoon to a crest of 12.6 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 07/18/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Fri Sat Sun Location Stg Stg Day/Time 12am 12am 12am Pecos River Artesia 6E 12.5 10.1 Thu 6pm 10.8 11.6 12.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 730 AM MDT.
